item.title: Need help on server
item.dc:creator: @GangstaNerd GangstaNerd
item.description:
@GangstaNerd wrote:

Go into your client
and search for, ( Ctrl+F) and type in the servers name, Mines ‘pietyscape’ So this is what came up

public void highscores() { clearQuestInterface(); sendQuest("@dbl@PietyScape", 8144); //Title sendQuest("@yel@Top 10 Players", 8145); for(int i = 0; i < 10; i++) { // you also need to change this for it to display more, simply the number you want it to display, say 20 = for(int i = 0; i < 20; i++) if(server.ranks[i] > 0) { sendQuest("@bla@Rank "+(i+1)+": @red@"+server.rankPpl[i]+ "@bla@ - Total Lvl:@red@ " +server.ranks[i], 8147+i); } }

Everytime I see pietyscape, I would change Pietyscape to - Dharockscape, or whatever you want your server to be

Read full topic

item.title: Need help on server
item.dc:creator: @GangstaNerd GangstaNerd
item.description:
@GangstaNerd wrote:

Kai. Open your server and find autospawn, Open up that and all your NPC’s should be there

[code]

//------NpcID—CoordX–CoordY–Height–RangeX1-RangeY1-RangeX2-RangeY2-WalkType-Descrption
//Home
spawn = 2253 3491 3219 0 0 0 0 0 1 Wise old man
spawn = 20 2542 3170 0 0 0 0 0 1 Paladin
spawn = 2244 2542 3169 0 0 0 0 0 1 Guide
spawn = 21 2542 3168 0 0 0 0 0 1 Hero
spawn = 23 3156 9631 0 0 0 0 0 1 Knight of ardougne
spawn = 252 3490 3219 0 0 0 0 0 1 Beggar lol
spawn = 250 3488 3219 0 0 0 0 0 1 Lady of the lake
spawn = 249 3487 3219 0 0 0 0 0 1 Lady of the lake
spawn = 2175 3489 3219 0 0 0 0 0 1 Factory Worker

//Dragon Zone
spawn = 1591 2712 9820 0 0 0 0 0 1 Iron Dragon
spawn = 1592 2717 9825 0 0 0 0 0 1 Steel Dragon
spawn = 2641 2713 9813 0 0 0 0 0 1 Dragon King
spawn = 54 2723 9823 0 0 0 0 0 1 Black Dragon
spawn = 3590 2727 9819 0 0 0 0 0 1 Steel Dragon
spawn = 53 2720 9821 0 0 0 0 0 1 Red Dragon
spawn = 52 2724 9819 0 0 0 0 0 1 Baby Dragon
spawn = 1592 2721 9814 0 0 0 0 0 1 Steel Dragon
spawn = 1590 2711 9815 0 0 0 0 0 1 Bronze Dragon
spawn = 2881 2718 9817 0 0 0 0 0 1 Dragon Boss
[ENDOFSPAWNLIST][/code]

You should see something like this, The x and y coords is where the NPC’s have been placed.
Go on your server and type ::coords or ::mypos and change where you want the NPC’s to be.

Hope it helps

Read full topic
